intro: Echites pulchellus, commonly known as the pretty devil, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking purple or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance make it a popular choice among gardeners.
